intro: Panisea unifolia, commonly known as the single-leaved panisea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its solitary, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
